verses.text: Moreover take thou up a lamentation for the princes of Israel,

similars.text: Hear ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel.
Now, thou son of man, take up a lamentation for Tyrus;
Say thou unto them, Thus saith the Lord God; This burden concerneth the prince in Jerusalem, and all the house of Israel that are among them.
Hear ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel.

verses.text: And say, What is thy mother? A lioness: she lay down among lions, she nourished her whelps among young lions.
And she brought up one of her whelps: it became a young lion, and it learned to catch the prey; it devoured men.

similars.text: And he went up and down among the lions, he became a young lion, and learned to catch the prey, and devoured men.
Now when she saw that she had waited, and her hope was lost, then she took another of her whelps, and made him a young lion.
Now when she saw that she had waited, and her hope was lost, then she took another of her whelps, and made him a young lion.
And he went up and down among the lions, he became a young lion, and learned to catch the prey, and devoured men.

verses.text: The nations also heard of him; he was taken in their pit, and they brought him with chains unto the land of Egypt.

similars.text: Then the nations set against him on every side from the provinces, and spread their net over him: he was taken in their pit.
Then the nations set against him on every side from the provinces, and spread their net over him: he was taken in their pit.

verses.text: Now when she saw that she had waited, and her hope was lost, then she took another of her whelps, and made him a young lion.

similars.text: And she brought up one of her whelps: it became a young lion, and it learned to catch the prey; it devoured men.
And she brought up one of her whelps: it became a young lion, and it learned to catch the prey; it devoured men.

verses.text: And he went up and down among the lions, he became a young lion, and learned to catch the prey, and devoured men.

similars.text: And she brought up one of her whelps: it became a young lion, and it learned to catch the prey; it devoured men.
Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.
And she brought up one of her whelps: it became a young lion, and it learned to catch the prey; it devoured men.

verses.text: And he knew their desolate palaces, and he laid waste their cities; and the land was desolate, and the fulness thereof, by the noise of his roaring.

similars.text: Then said I: Lord, how long? And he said: Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the land be utterly desolate;
The young lions roared upon him, and yelled, and they made his land waste: his cities are burned without inhabitant.

verses.text: Then the nations set against him on every side from the provinces, and spread their net over him: he was taken in their pit.

similars.text: The nations also heard of him; he was taken in their pit, and they brought him with chains unto the land of Egypt.
The nations also heard of him; he was taken in their pit, and they brought him with chains unto the land of Egypt.

verses.text: And they put him in ward in chains, and brought him to the king of Babylon: they brought him into holds, that his voice should no more be heard upon the mountains of Israel.

similars.text: Then he put out the eyes of Zedekiah; and the king of Babylon bound him in chains, and carried him to Babylon, and put him in prison till the day of his death.
Moreover he put out Zedekiah's eyes, and bound him with chains, to carry him to Babylon.
Moreover he put out Zedekiah's eyes, and bound him with chains, to carry him to Babylon.
Then he put out the eyes of Zedekiah; and the king of Babylon bound him in chains, and carried him to Babylon, and put him in prison till the day of his death.

verses.text: Thy mother is like a vine in thy blood, planted by the waters: she was fruitful and full of branches by reason of many waters.
And she had strong rods for the sceptres of them that bare rule, and her stature was exalted among the thick branches, and she appeared in her height with the multitude of her branches.
But she was plucked up in fury, she was cast down to the ground, and the east wind dried up her fruit: her strong rods were broken and withered; the fire consumed them.

similars.text: And fire is gone out of a rod of her branches, which hath devoured her fruit, so that she hath no strong rod to be a sceptre to rule. This is a lamentation, and shall be for a lamentation.
And fire is gone out of a rod of her branches, which hath devoured her fruit, so that she hath no strong rod to be a sceptre to rule. This is a lamentation, and shall be for a lamentation.

verses.text: And now she is planted in the wilderness, in a dry and thirsty ground.
And fire is gone out of a rod of her branches, which hath devoured her fruit, so that she hath no strong rod to be a sceptre to rule. This is a lamentation, and shall be for a lamentation.

similars.text: And thou beheldest that a part thereof brought forth good fruit, and a part thereof brought forth wild fruit; and because I plucked not the branches thereof and cast them into the fire, behold, they have overcome the good branch that it hath withered away.
But she was plucked up in fury, she was cast down to the ground, and the east wind dried up her fruit: her strong rods were broken and withered; the fire consumed them.

And again I say unto you, the Spirit saith: Behold, the ax is laid at the root of the tree; therefore every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit shall be hewn down and cast into the fire, yea, a fire which cannot be consumed, even an unquenchable fire. Behold, and remember, the Holy One hath spoken it.
But she was plucked up in fury, she was cast down to the ground, and the east wind dried up her fruit: her strong rods were broken and withered; the fire consumed them.
